bibl.title: Letter from Michael E. Conner to the International Health Board, August 28, 1923

div1.p: Connor sends the International Health Board copies of two reports filed about the case of Luis Villalobos Corona and explains that a railroad strike may delay the arrival of additional reports, but that Frederick R. Russell has been carried the liver section to the United States.

div1.head: Letter from Michael E. Connor to the International Health Board, August 28, 1923
div1.opener:
Tampico, Tamps.
August 28th, 1923.
International Health Board
61 Broadway
New York City
Sirs:
div1.p:
Next attached please find copies of reports from
our Inspector-General GaZona and Dr. J. M. Herrera, Colima,
Col. re: case Sr. Luis B. Corona, certified as having died
of yellow fever, at Colima, August 21st, 1923.

The report from Dr. Hurtado who last attended the
deceased nor the reports of Dr. Galindo who performed the
autopsy have not been received in this office. They may be
delayed for sometime on account of railroad strikes which
tend to become general through out this country within the
next week and for this reason I am sending such reports as we
have at this time bearing on the case.

Section of the deceased liver was carried to the
States by Dr. Russell.
